intro: Endodeca hastata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved starflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes other species such as willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and lanceolate, often arranged alternately along the stem. Endodeca hastata is adapted to high-altitude environments, showcasing resilience to cold and low-nutrient soils.
